ai-tika-vin01t23:257_1: But if he takes hold of one shrine, he took a flower in the Cetiya mountain,
ai-tika-vin01t23:257_2: standing there, she stood the craft,
ai-tika-vin01t23:257_3: And by this one gives the gift of Queen Subhaddā, that is the end of suffering.
ai-tika-vin01t23:257_4: It is allowed to give it to another if he has given it to another, and then eat it.
ai-tika-vin01t23:257_5: “Where is it allowable to give by one who is prevented for him: “Here’s, without getting enough to give it to him that enemy,” and with the got to do the point of his ownership, wherever he wants, that is allowed to take it.”
ai-tika-vin01t23:257_6: if he wishes, “Give it,” and he is said, “We wish to give,” and he can’t be given, and whenever he likes.
ai-tika-vin01t23:257_7: Because of the time of dawn, he thinks: “We will give you a teaching such as yourself.”
ai-tika-vin01t23:257_8: Knowing this matter, he surmounted it for his own advantages and these three factors:
ai-tika-vin01t23:258_0: The training rule on what is intended
ai-tika-vin01t23:259_0: The third sub-chapter on almsbowls is finished.
ai-tika-vin01t23:260_0: Thus the Vinaya assembled in the Commentaries,
ai-tika-vin01t23:261_0: The commentary on relinquishment is finished.
ai-tika-vin01t23:262_0: The second section for recitation is finished.
